installPrerequisites.headline: Install required tools
installPrerequisites.content:
Before we have a look at this course and the example exercise, we need to download and install a few software tools.
  • Please download and install the newest Java JDK (at least Java JDK 16). Make sure to choose JDK and not JRE.
  • Please download and install Eclipse IDE for Java Developers (2021â€‘03 or later)
  • Please download and install SourceTree with git (4.1.4 or later for macOS and 3.4.6 or later for Windows).
installPrerequisites.hint: Make sure to also install the git command line tools while installing SourceTree. In case you are using Linux, you can e.g. use Git Kraken or the command line.

sourceTreeSetup.headline: Set up SourceTree
sourceTreeSetup.content: Watch the following video and follow the steps to set up SourceTree. Afterwards we will be done with the setup and can have a look at the course page and its content.

exercises.headline: Exercises
exercises.content: This tab lists all exercises for the selected course.

exerciseRow.headline: Current week
exerciseRow.content: The exercises of the current week will be displayed at the top of the exercise list.

currentExercise.headline: Current Exercise
currentExercise.content: In this tutorial we will have a look at the <tt>Hello World</tt> exercise.

exerciseType.headline: Exercise type
exerciseType.content: The exercise type can be distinguished by the exercise icon. Here it is a programming exercise.

exerciseTags.headline: Exercise tags
exerciseTags.content: The listed tags will further classify the exercises, e.g. by difficulty.

courseInformation.headline: Course information
courseInformation.content: This box displays general course information, such as the number of exercises and the time frame of the course.

upcomingDeadlines.headline: Upcoming deadlines
upcomingDeadlines.content: Here you can see which exercises are due in the next few days.

lectures.headline: Lectures
lectures.content: You can find and download all lecture slides from this tab.

statistics.headline: Statistics
statistics.content: This tab shows statistics about your grades and exercise performance so far.

startExercise.headline: Start with your first programming exercise
startExercise.content: Click on the <tt>Start exercise</tt> button to start working on the exercise. This action takes a few seconds, since a personal repository is being set up for you in the background

cloneRepository.headline: Clone repository in SourceTree
cloneRepository.content: Watch the following video to learn how to clone a git repository in SourceTree. After this step, you should click on the <tt>X</tt> button in the top right to stop the tutorial and apply the steps you saw in the video. Afterwards, resume the tutorial from your account menu

inspectSourceTree.headline: Inspect SourceTree
inspectSourceTree.content: Watch the following video to get acquainted with the basic functions in SourceTree.

importEclipse.headline: Import the Java project in Eclipse
importEclipse.content: Watch the following video to learn how to import the project in Eclipse.

inspectProject.headline: Inspect Project
inspectProject.content: In this video we will inspect the project and solve the given task.

commitAndPush.headline: Submit your changes
commitAndPush.content: Watch the following video to learn how to commit and push your changes.

reviewResult.headline: Review your result
reviewResult.content: After you have committed and pushed your changes as described in the previous video, the result will be automatically refreshed and displayed here. Artemis uses test cases to automatically assess your solution. If you now click on the exercise panel, you will come to the exercise detail page to review the test case results.
